intro: Sidneya, commonly known as the "southern cross" or "white star," is a genus of flowering plants native to South America. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white or pale blue flowers. The plants typically grow as shrubs or small trees, often with leathery, evergreen leaves. Sidneya species are known for their ornamental value and are cultivated for their elegant appearance. They thrive in well-drained soils and prefer full sun to partial shade.
